name: German Window Simulator
description:
One of the first things an American notices once they spend a bit of time in Germany are those funky windows. How do they open? Why do the blinds work like that? What does it mean to "kippen"? 

I thought it would be fun pay tribute to my home for the past several years and use the Playdate's crank to simulate pulling on the pulley thing.

Step one of this was intended to just be when you opened the blinds a different scene was displayed, and then step two would involve a light game in trying to balance on a thermometer the room temperature by openings/closing/tilting the window and lowering the blinds. But this month was just too crazy to have the time for all of that. Hopefully one day!
